isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE, FENDERS, AND BUMPER - PROSTAR™ - REMOVE AND INSTALL PROCEDURES - HOOD

caution.para: Increased hood-tilt, after disconnection of the hood tilt assist cylinder, will cause the ends of the hood tilt assist torsion bars to rotate into and damage the radiator and/or oil coolers. Prior to removing the hood tilt assist cylinder, remove the torsion bars so they will not damage any components.

step1.para: Remove four mount screws from the lower portion of the grille ( Figure 13, Items 3 and 4).
To remove the grille, lift the grille out to release the tabs from the tab inserts ( Figure 13, Items 2 and 3).
Place the grille upside down on a padded surface to protect the finished surface of the grille.
Unlatch and open the hood.
Disconnect the headlight harness connectors from both sides of the hood assembly.

warning.para: The hood torsion bars become spring loaded as the hood is closed and are unloaded when the hood is in the open position. Therefore, the hood must be in the open position to remove or install the torsion bars from the hood. Failure to comply may result in injury to personnel.

note.para: Prior to removal, mark each torsion bar to show which side the torsion bars mount on the hood.

step1.para: Remove three bolts from the left torsion bar mount plate.
Remove left torsion bar mount plate from left torsion bar.
Loosen, but do not remove, two bolts on the left torsion bar load bracket.
Slide the left torsion bar out of the hood hinge rod and remove left torsion bar.
Remove three bolts from the right torsion bar mount plate.
Remove right torsion bar mount plate from right torsion bar.
Loosen, but do not remove, two bolts on the right torsion bar load bracket.
Slide the right torsion bar out of the hood hinge rod and remove right torsion bar.
Tilt the hood assembly to a 45-degree angle and support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist cylinder assembly.
Unlatch the locking clip from the upper retainer pin.
Remove the upper retainer pin from the tilt assist cylinder.
Unlatch the locking clip from the lower retainer pin.
Remove the lower retainer pin from the tilt assist cylinder.
Remove the tilt assist cylinder from the hood.
Release latches and lower the tilt-away bumper.
Close the hood, but do not fasten latches.
Remove two bolts and nuts from hood hinge bracket and hood hinge rod.

warning.para: The hood is extremely heavy and requires a lifting device with a strap or a minimum of four people to remove or install the hood assembly. Failure to comply may result in injury to personnel.

step1.para: Remove the hood and place in a secure place to prevent damage to the hood.
To remove D-shaped hood insulators, use an adequate punch to tap insulators free from the hood hinge rod.
To install D-shaped hood insulators, measure and mark the center point of each D-shaped hood insulator.
Using a sharp knife, cut the D-shaped hood insulators on the marked center line.
Insert the D-shaped hood insulators into the hood hinge rod.

warning.para: The hood is extremely heavy and requires a lifting device with a strap or a minimum of four individuals to remove or install the hood assembly. Failure to comply may result in injury to personnel.

step1.para: Install the hood on the vehicle and align the hood hinge bracket mounting holes ( Figure 22, Items 1 and 6).

Install two bolts and nuts to hood hinge bracket and hood hinge rod ( Figure 22, Items 2 and 3). The bolts must be installed pointing toward the center of the vehicle. Torque bolts to 15 to 18 lbf-ft (20 to 24 N•m).
Raise the hood to approximately a 45-degree angle and support the hood.
Secure the tilt assist cylinder to the hood with the upper retainer pin and secure locking clip onto upper retainer pin ( Figure 21).
Align bottom of tilt assist cylinder. Install lower retaining pin and secure lower retaining pin with locking clip ( Figure 21).
Install the right torsion bar through the hood hinge rod and align right torsion bar on the load bracket ( Figure 20, Items 1, 2, and 6).
Position right torsion bar mount plate on the right torsion bar ( Figure 20, Items 1 and 4).
Install three bolts in right torsion bar mount plate ( Figure 20, Items 3 and 4). Torque bolts to 6 to 8 lbf-ft (8 to 11 N•m).
Secure the right torsion bar load bracket by tightening two bolts ( Figure 20, Items 5 and 6).
Install the left torsion bar through the hood hinge rod and align left torsion bar on the left load bracket ( Figure 19, Items 1, 3, and 5).
Position left torsion bar mount plate on the left torsion bar ( Figure 19, Items 2 and 3).
Install three bolts in left torsion bar mount plate ( Figure 19, Items 2 and 6). Torque bolts to 6 to 8 lbf-ft (8 to 11 N•m).
Secure the left torsion bar load bracket by tightening two bolts ( Figure 19, Items 4 and 5).
Connect both headlight harness connectors to the front chassis wiring harness ( Figure 18, Items 1 and 2).

note.para: Before installing the grille, inspect the hood insert holes and ensure that all six insert tabs are properly attached to the grille.

step1.para: Align grille insert tabs with the hood insert holes ( Figure 13, Items 2 and 3).
With the palm of your hand, press the grille at all six insert tab locations to seat grille onto the hood ( Figure 13, Items 1, 2, and 3).
Install four mount screws in bottom of grille ( Figure 13, Items 3 and 4). Torque screws to 4 to 5 lbf-ft (5 to 7 N•m).
Raise the tilt-away bumper and secure latches.
Check hood adjustment and adjust as needed. Refer to Hood - Adjustment procedures in this manual.

svcsubproc.title: Hood - Adjustment

note.para: Hood height adjustment at the cowl and rear edge of hood is not adjustable. The rear hood supports are designed so they can not be aligned incorrectly.

important.para: The cab air suspension must be fully aired up before hood adjustment. Failure to do so will result in binding of the hood on the rear supports causing premature wear.

svcsubproc.para: The hood adjustment is done by moving the hood hinge bracket located at the front crossmember.

step1.para: To adjust the hood left to right:

step2.para: Release latches and lower the tilt-away bumper.
Loosen the hood hinge mount bolts and slide the hood hinge bracket left or right.
Check the alignment with the hood contour lines. If the hood alignment is proper, tighten the hood hinge bracket mount bolts. Torque bolts to 65 to 80 lbf-ft (88 to 108 N•m).

step1.para: To adjust hood forward and back:

step2.para: Release latches and lower the tilt-away bumper.
Loosen the hood hinge mount bolts at the hood hinge bracket.
Slide the hood forward or backward as required.
Check for proper distance between the rear edge of hood and the windshield.
Tighten the hood hinge bracket mount bolts. Torque bolts to 65 to 80 lbf-ft (88 to 108 N•m).
